definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: I beg you overlook my rudeness.
sentences.chinese: 我请求你宽恕我的失礼。

sentences.english: The string quartet was calling, and anyway it would have been bad manners.
sentences.chinese: 弦乐四重奏在召唤，缺席怎么说都太失礼了。

sentences.english: I'm sorry I was rude ; I take back everything I said.
sentences.chinese: 对不起我失礼了，我承认我所说的全错了。

sentences.english: There's social faux pas around the molestation of children.
sentences.chinese: 这种社会性的失礼，是对小孩子的骚扰。

sentences.english: His discourteous behavior can't be forgived.
sentences.chinese: 他的举止失礼是不能原谅的。

sentences.english: where a friend tells an off-colored, or inappropriate joke.
sentences.chinese: 有一个朋友开了一个失礼的或是不合适的玩笑。

sentences.english: To ask more would be churlish.
sentences.chinese: 提出更多的要求就会失礼了。

sentences.english: Her one worry was her sudden tendency to become light-headed.
sentences.chinese: 她唯一担心就是她的举止会突然的变得轻浮失礼。

sentences.english: Even though we were busy, we thought it would be disrespectful not to put in an appearance.
sentences.chinese: 纵然我们很忙，我们认为不出席是失礼的。

sentences.english: A: I’d like to apologize for behaving rudely at your party last night.
sentences.chinese: 我想对我昨晚在晚会的失礼向你道歉。

sentences.english: Surely none of us would be an ungracious host.
sentences.chinese: 我们中必然没人愿做一个失礼的主人。

sentences.english: She is so near to me that it almost seems indelicate to speak of her.
sentences.chinese: 她和我非常亲近，所以谈论她我觉得几乎是失礼。

sentences.english: All such familiarities should be avoided.
sentences.chinese: 这种失礼的举动都该避免。

sentences.english: It is indelicate of you to mention her marriage problem.
sentences.chinese: 你提到她的婚姻难题，这很失礼。

definition: to forget one's manners/to forget oneself/to lose self-control (in a situation)
slip of the tongue/indiscretion/to blurt out a secret
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
etiquette/(old) gradation of etiquette with social status
variant of 魯莽|鲁莽[lu3 mang3]
to offer an apology/to make amends
